container.heading: Programs in Computer Science, Engineering, or Technology Education

section.heading: Requirements for Computer Science, Engineering, or Technology Education Instructional Programs.

para.text: Each local school system shall offer a computer science, engineering, or technology education program in grades 9—12 which shall enable students to:
Select computer science, engineering, or technology electives or career and technical education (CTE) programs of study.
Maryland Computer Science, Engineering, or Technology Education Program. The comprehensive instructional program shall:
Provide for the diversity of student needs, abilities, and interests in the high school learning years; and
Include the Maryland K—12 Computer Science Standards and/or Standards for Technological and Engineering Literacy.

Curriculum Documents. Consistent with Education Article, §4-111, Annotated Code of Maryland, each local school system shall provide computer science, engineering, or technology education curriculum documents for the secondary schools under its jurisdiction that:
Include the content standards set forth in §B of this regulation; and
Are aligned with the State standards, as developed by the Maryland State Department of Education in collaboration with local school systems.
Student Participation. Each student shall have the opportunity to participate in the computer science, engineering, or technology education program required by this chapter.

section.heading: Certification Procedures.
section.text: By September 1, 2007, and each 5 years after that, each local superintendent of schools shall have certified to the State’s Superintendent of Schools that the instructional programming within grades 9—12 meets, at a minimum, the requirements set forth in Regulation .01B—C of this chapter.
